intro: Calophanes jasminum-mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
